alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 3:18PM PDT until May 23 at 4:38PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warnings continue for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. Minor flooding is forecast to continue for the next several days for both rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stehekin River at Stehekin. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, The river may be out of its banks in spots on parts of Stehekin Valley Road and Company Creek Road, especially from Harlequin Bridge to about seven miles upstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 23.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 25.8 feet late Friday evening. It will fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.9 feet on 05/18/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Thursday morning at 800 AM PDT.
